channel.title: Rtos on OSRTOS
channel.description: Recent content in Rtos on OSRTOS

item.title: Azure RTOS
item.description: This advanced real-time operating system (RTOS) is designed specifically for deeply embedded applications. Among the multiple benefits it provides are advanced scheduling facilities, message passing, interrupt management, and messaging services. Azure RTOS ThreadX has many advanced features, including picokernel architecture, preemption threshold, event chaining, and a rich set of system services.

item.title: Contiki-NG
item.description: Contiki-NG is an operating system for resource-constrained devices in the Internet of Things. Contiki-NG contains an RFC-compliant, low-power IPv6 communication stack, enabling Internet connectivity.

item.title: uC/OS-II
item.description: μC/OS-II is a portable, ROMable, scalable, preemptive, real-time deterministic multitasking kernel for microprocessors, microcontrollers and DSPs.

item.title: uC/OS-III
item.description: µC/OS-III is a highly portable, ROMable, scalable, preemptive, real-time, deterministic, multitasking kernel for microprocessors, microcontrollers and DSPs.

item.title: Drone
item.description: Drone is an Embedded Operating System for writing real-time applications in Rust.

item.title: TencentOS-tiny
item.description: TencentOS tiny is a real-time operating system developed by Tencent for the Internet of Things. It features low power consumption, low resource consumption, modularity, security and reliability, and can effectively improve the development efficiency of IoT terminal products.

item.title: QuarkTS
item.description: QuarkTS is a simple non-Preemtive Real-Time OS with a quasi-static scheduler for embedded multi-tasking applications.

item.title: HyperC
item.description: The hyperC OS is a real time-operating system (RTOS) designed for various IoT applications. All the designs are aimed at the optimization of ARM Cortex CPUs.

item.title: Frosted
item.description: Frosted is an acronym that means “Free Operating Systems for Tiny Embedded Devices”. The goal of this project is to provide a Free (as in Freedom) kernel for embedded systems, which exposes a POSIX-compliant system call API.

item.title: TinyOS
item.description: TinyOS is an open source, BSD-licensed operating system designed for low-power wireless devices, such as those used in sensor networks, ubiquitous computing, personal area networks, smart buildings, and smart meters.

item.title: Phoenix-RTOS
item.description: Phoenix-RTOS is an open-source, microkernel-based, realtime operating system for resource constrained devices.

item.title: Tock
item.description: Tock is an embedded operating system designed for running multiple concurrent, mutually distrustful applications on Cortex-M based embedded platforms. The kernel and device drivers are written in Rust.

item.title: ATK2
item.description: The TOPPERS/ATK (Automotive Kernel) is a real-time operating system for automotive system control publicly released by the TOPPERS project.

item.title: MaRTE
item.description: MaRTE OS is a Hard Real-Time Operating System for embedded applications that follows the Minimal Real-Time POSIX.13 subset.

item.title: cocoOS
item.description: cocoOS is a free, open source, cooperative task scheduler, based on coroutines targeted for embedded microcontrollers like AVR, MSP430 and STM32.

item.title: MOE
item.description: MOE is an event-driven scheduler system for 8/16/32-bit MCUs. MOE means “Minds Of Embedded system”.

item.title: TizenRT
item.description: TizenRT is a lightweight RTOS-based platform to support low-end IoT devices

item.title: LiteOS
item.description: Huawei LiteOS is a lightweight open-source IoT OS and a smart hardware development platform. It simplifies IoT device development and device connectivity, makes services smarter, delivers superb user experience, and provides better data protection. Huawei LiteOS is designed for smart homes, wearables, IoV, and intelligent manufacturing applications.

item.title: Mongoose OS
item.description: Mongoose OS - an open source Operating System for Internet of Things. Supported microcontrollers: ESP32, ESP8266, CC3220, CC3200, STM32F4. Amazon AWS IoT & Google IoT Core integrated. Code in C or JavaScript.

item.title: AliOS Things
item.description: AliOS Things is designed for low power, resource constrained MCU, connectivity SoC, greatly suitable for IoT devices. AliOS Things is not just a RTOS, it contains full stack of software components and tools for building IoT devices.

item.title: eChronos
item.description: The eChronos RTOS is a real-time operating system (RTOS) originally developed by NICTA and Breakaway Consulting Pty. Ltd. It is intended for tightly resource-constrained devices without memory protection.

item.title: Trampoline
item.description: Trampoline is a static RTOS for small embedded systems. Its API is aligned with OSEK/VDX OS and AUTOSAR OS 4.2 standards.

item.title: seL4
item.description: The world’s first operating-system kernel with an end-to-end proof of implementation correctness and security enforcement is available as open source.

item.title: uKOS
item.description: uKOS is a multi-tasking OS suitable for small embedded µController systems. It is based on a preventive multitasking scheduler.

item.title: embox
item.description: Embox is a configurable operating system kernel designed for resource constrained and embedded systems.

item.title: IntrOS
item.description: Free, simple and tiny cooperative operating system (OS) designed for deeply embedded applications.

item.title: LibreRTOS
item.description: LibreRTOS is a portable single-stack Real Time Operating System. All tasks share the same stack, allowing a large number or tasks to be created even on architectures with low RAM, such as ATmega328P (2kB).

item.title: TNeo
item.description: TNeo is a well-formed and carefully tested preemptive real-time kernel for 16- and 32-bits MCUs. It is compact and fast.

item.title: F9 Microkernel
item.description: F9 microkernel is a microkernel-based (L4-style) kernel to support running real-time and time-sharing applications (for example, wireless communications) for ARM Cortex-M series microprocessors with efficiency (performance + power consumption) and security (memory protection + isolated execution) in mind.

item.title: Apache Mynewt
item.description: Apache Mynewt OS is a real-time, modular operating system for connected IoT devices that need to operate for long periods of time under power, memory, and storage constraints. It provides a complete environment for prototyping, developing, and managing em

item.title: BitThunder
item.description: A Reliable Real-Time Operating System & Application Framework.

item.title: distortos
item.description: distortos is an object-oriented C++ RTOS for microcontrollers.

item.title: mbed OS
item.description: mbed OS is an open-source embedded operating system designed specifically for the “things” in the Internet of Things (IoT). It includes all the features you need to develop a connected product based on an ARM Cortex-M microcontroller.

item.title: Prex
item.description: Prex is an open source, royalty-free, real-time operating system for embedded systems. It is designed and implemented for resource-constrained systems that require predictable timing behavior. The highly portable code of Prex is written in 100% ANSI C bas

item.title: Protothreads
item.description: Protothreads are extremely lightweight stackless threads designed for severely memory constrained systems.

item.title: RIOT
item.description: RIOT is a real-time multi-threading operating system that supports a range of devices that are typically found in the Internet of Things (IoT): 8-bit, 16-bit and 32-bit microcontrollers.

item.title: RTIC
item.description: RIOT, the hardware accelerated Rust RTOS. A concurrency framework for building real-time systems.

item.title: scmRTOS
item.description: scmRTOS is tiny Real-Time Preemptive Operating System intended for use with Single-Chip Microcontrollers. scmRTOS is capable to run on tiny uCs with as small amount of RAM as 512 bytes. The RTOS is written on C++ and supports various platforms.

item.title: StateOS
item.description: Free, extremely simple and amazingly tiny real-time operating system (RTOS) designed for deeply embedded applications. Target: ARM Cortex-M, STM8. It was inspired by the concept of a state machine.

item.title: TI-RTOS Kernel
item.description: TI-RTOS Kernel (formerly known as SYS/BIOS

item.title: TNKernel
item.description: TNKernel is a compact and very fast real-time kernel for the embedded 32/16/8 bits microprocessors.

item.title: uSmartX
item.description: uSmartX is a non-preemptive, multitasking, priority based RTOS.

item.title: Zephyr
item.description: The Zephyr™ Project is a scalable, real-time operating system (RTOS) supporting multiple hardware architectures, optimized for resource constrained devices, and built with security in mind. This Linux Foundation hosted project embraces open source development values and governance on its mission to unite leaders from across the industry to produce a best-in-breed solution.

item.title: Atomthreads
item.description: Atomthreads is a free, lightweight, portable, real-time scheduler for embedded systems.

item.title: BeRTOS
item.description: BeRTOS is a real time open source operating system supplied with drivers and libraries designed for the rapid development of embedded software.

item.title: BRTOS
item.description: BRTOS is a lightweight preemptive real time operating system designed for low end microcontrollers.

item.title: ChibiOS/RT
item.description: ChibiOS is a complete development environment for embedded applications including RTOS, an HAL, peripheral drivers, support files and a development environment.

item.title: Contiki OS
item.description: Contiki is an open source operating system for the Internet of Things. Contiki connects tiny low-cost, low-power microcontrollers to the Internet.

item.title: DuinOS
item.description: DuinOS is a small multithreading real time operating system (RTOS), based on the FreeRTOS kernel, for Arduino compatible boards.

item.title: eCos
item.description: eCos is a free open source real-time operating system intended for embedded applications. The highly configurable nature of eCos allows the operating system to be customised to precise application requirements, delivering the best possible run-time perfor

item.title: Erika Enterprise
item.description: Erika Enterprise is the first open-source Free RTOS that has been certified OSEK/VDX compliant!.

item.title: Femto OS
item.description: Femto OS: RTOS for small MCU’s like AVR.

item.title: FreeRTOS
item.description: FreeRTOS is a market leading RTOS from Amazon Web Services that supports more than 35 architectures. It is distributed under the MIT license.

item.title: Freescale MQX
item.description: The Freescale MQX Real-Time Operating System (RTOS) provides real-time performance within a small, configurable footprint. The RTOS is tightly integrated with the latest 32-bit MCUs and MPUs from Freescale and is provided with commonly used device drivers

item.title: FunkOS
item.description: FunkOS is an RTOS for 8-32 bit MCUs including AVR, MSP430, and Cortex M3. Both C and C++ kernels avaiable. Key features include preemption, periodic events, device drivers, and mutex/semaphores. Includes a variety of graphics and filesystem middleware.

item.title: Fusion Embedded RTOS
item.description: The Fusion Embedded RTOS (Real-Time Operating System) from Unicoi Systems is a Real-Time OS designed and optimized for networking and media-centric processors.

item.title: MARK3
item.description: Mark3 is a sophisticated, modern RTOS and application development platform, targeted towards a growing list of today’s most compelling embedded devices.

item.title: Nut/OS
item.description: Nut/OS is an intentionally simple RTOS for the ATmega128, which provides a minimum of services to run Nut/Net, the TCP/IP stack.

item.title: NuttX
item.description: NuttX is a real-time operating system (RTOS) with an emphasis on standards compliance and small footprint. Scalable from 8-bit to 32-bit microcontroller environments, the primary governing standards in NuttX are Posix and ANSI standards.

item.title: RT-Thread
item.description: RT-Thread is an open source real-time operating system for embedded devices from China. RT-Thread RTOS is a scalable real-time operating system: a tiny kernel for ARM Cortex-M0, Cortex-M3/4, or a full feature system in ARM Cortex-A8, ARM Cortex-A9 DualCor

item.title: RTAI
item.description: RTAI is the RealTime Application Interface for Linux - which lets you write applications with strict timing constraints for your favourite operating system. The RTAI distribution includes RTAI-Lab, a tool chain to convert block diagrams into RTAI executab

item.title: RTEMS
item.description: RTEMS is an open source RTOS that supports open standard application programming interfaces such as POSIX. It is used in space flight, medical, networking and many more embedded devices.

item.title: StratifyOS
item.description: StratifyOS is a powerful embedded RTOS for the ARM Cortex M microcontrollers.

item.title: Xenomai
item.description: Xenomai is a real-time development framework cooperating with the Linux kernel, in order to provide a pervasive, interface-agnostic, hard real-time support to user-space applications, seamlessly integrated into the GNU/Linux environment.
